argo.rule_optimisation.rule_optimisation.optimisation_functions module¶

Classes for calculating optimisation metrics

class argo.rule_optimisation.rule_optimisation.optimisation_functions.Precision[source]¶

Bases: object

Calculates the Precision using Numpy

fit(y_true: Union[numpy.array, pandas.core.series.Series], y_pred: Union[numpy.array, pandas.core.series.Series], sample_weight=None) → float[source]¶

Calculates the Precision using Numpy.

Parameters

  • y_true (Union[np.array, pd.Series]) – The target column.

  • y_pred (Union[np.array, pd.Series]) – The binary predictor column.

  • sample_weight ([type], optional) – Row-wise weights to apply. Defaults to None.

Returns

The Precision score.

Return type

float

class argo.rule_optimisation.rule_optimisation.optimisation_functions.AlertsPerDay(n_alerts_expected_per_day: int, no_of_days_in_file: int)[source]¶

Bases: object

Calculates the negative squared difference between the number of alerts per day in the binary predictor vs the expected.

fit(y_pred: Union[numpy.array, pandas.core.series.Series]) → float[source]¶

Calculates the negative squared difference between the number of alerts per day in the binary predictor vs the expected.

Parameters

  • y_pred (Union[np.array, pd.Series]) – The binary predictor column.

  • n_alerts_expected_per_day – The expected number of alerts per day for the given rule.

  • no_of_days_in_file – The number of days of data provided in y_pred.

Returns

The negative squared difference between the number of alerts

per day in y_pred vs n_alerts_expected_per_day.

Return type

float

class argo.rule_optimisation.rule_optimisation.optimisation_functions.PercVolume(perc_vol_expected: float)[source]¶

Bases: object

Calculates the negative squared difference between the percentage of the overall volume that the binary predictor flags vs the expected.

fit(y_pred: Union[numpy.array, pandas.core.series.Series]) → float[source]¶

Calculates the negative squared difference between the percentage of the overall volume that the binary predictor flags vs the expected.

Parameters

  • y_pred (Union[np.array, pd.Series]) – The binary predictor column.

  • n_alerts_expected_per_day – The expected number of alerts per day for the given rule.

  • no_of_days_in_file – The number of days of data provided in y_pred.

Returns

the negative squared difference between the percentage of

the overall volume that y_pred flags vs perc_vol_expected.

Return type

float
